title: Security for loans
context: §209-31 Security for loans. Security for any loan when not available is not required, however, whenever property other than personal property and inventory, is purchased with the loan funds, a mortgage or pledge of such property shall be required as security for the loan. The director of business, economic development, and tourism may, in the director&rsquo;s discretion, permit the mortgage or pledge to be subordinated to the lien of a financial institution or government lending agency in the event the subordination should become necessary for the borrower to secure additional funds. [L 1961, c 189, §17; Supp, §98P-17; HRS §209-31; am L 1976, c 205, §1(2); gen ch 1985; am L 1987, c 336, §7; am L 1990, c 293, §8]
